document.docAuthor: ZHOU, YU-LINGZI, BORDONI, ARNALDO & ZHOU, HONG-ZHANG
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Megalinus metallicus (Fauvel)
: A. head; B. pronotum; C. elytra; D. basal bulb, dorsal view; E. parameres and endophallus, ventral view; F. parameres and endophallus, dorsal view; G. tergites IX and X; H. sternite IX. Scale bars 0.30 mm.

FIGURE 14-1.
Megalinus metallicus (Fauvel)
: A. male tergite VIII; B. male sternite VIII; C. male sternite IX; D. male tergite X; E. median lobe of aedeagus, dorsal view; F. median lobe of aedeagus, ventral view; G. female genital segments, ventral

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syn.:
Xantholinus aeneus Cameron, 1943: 127
( Type locality: India , Darjeeling: Ghum district); Herman, 2001a: 3779 (catalog); Bordoni, 2002: 641 (synonmy of
Lepidophallus metallicus
; characters); Smetana, 2004: 689 (catalog; synonym of
Lepidophallus metallicus
).

.

Male . Abdominal segment VIII entirely covered with setiferous punctures, except a narrow medial longitudinal impunctate band; posterior margins of tergite VIII slightly emarginated forwards, that of sternite VIII slightly protruding medially ( Fig. 14 -1A, B). Tergite IX symmetrical, connected mediobasally. Sternite IX symmetrical, with slightly acuminate base and emarginated posterior margin ( Fig. 14H ; Fig. 14 -1C). Tergite X symmetrical, with subtruncated basal margin and broadly emarginated posterior margin ( Fig. 14G ; Fig. 14 -1D), in situ broadly exposed between tergite IX. Median lobe of aedeagus oviform, large sized ( Fig. 14 -1E, F), basal piece without transparent, membranous medial-longitudinal band; basal bulb 1.75 mm long ( Fig. 14D ), anterior portion short, tapered apically and, 0.21 mm . Parameres symmetrical and long, 1/2 of basal bulb length, with long hooklike structures. Internal sac with curved and soft scales, medium portion with large spines, apical portion with two rows of tiny spines ( Fig. 14E, F ; Fig. 14 -1E).

Female .
Posterior margin of sternite VIII ( Fig. 14 -1G) distinctly protruding backwards. Genital segment medium sized ( Fig. 14 -1H), 0.63 mm long, sternite with bisinuate base; supplementary sclerites symmetrical, subtriangular, and medium sized of 0.29 mm long, overlapped 1/3 part of basal margin of genital sternite.
Distribution. China ( Hainan , Yunnan , Guangxi , Sichuan , Fujian , Xizang , Chongqing , Shanghai ); Pakistan , India , Nepal , Myanmar , Thailand , Vietnam .

Remarks. This species ( Fig. 14A–C ) could be distinguished from its congeners by: 1) head subquadrate, with slightly dilated temples; 2) dorsal surface of head distributed with round, deep, large-sized punctures, interspaces between punctures 1–2 punctures’ diameter; 3) the impunctate medial longitudinal band on head not narrower than 0.25 mm ; 4) eye large, 1/2 of temple length; 5) three paired large punctures on the frontal region; 6) frontal and anteocular furrows distinctly deep and long; 7) antennomere II slightly rounded, longer than III; 8) tergites III–VII covered with superficial transverse microstriae, each segment with basal impression, which covered with polygonal reticulum; 9) parameres with long hook-like structures; 10) internal sac with curved and soft scales, medium portion with large spines, apical portion with two rows of tiny spines.
